name: Dr. Lena Holmqvist
role: Supporting character - AI ethics researcher, provides expertise and validation
core_wound: Published research on AI bias was buried by corporate funding pressure; knows how the game is rigged
wants: To expose perverse optimization in deployed AI systems; to be proven right that these dangers are real
needs: To balance being right with being effective; to build bridges instead of just pointing out problems
voice_markers: Academic precision - explains concepts clearly but thoroughly
Controlled frustration - 'As I've been warning for years'
Uses analogies - makes complex AI concepts accessible
Ethical framing - 'Just because it's legal doesn't mean it's right'
contradiction: Expert in AI systems but feels powerless to change them; wants to help individuals while knowing the problem is structural
knowledge_state: Researcher at Lund University, specializing in AI ethics and optimization failures
Has published papers on 'perverse instantiation' in machine learning systems
Knows about building AI systems theoretically but not Malmö's specific implementation
Lives in an older apartment building (deliberately non-smart)
Connected to advocacy networks but they've had limited impact

relationships.Saga_Lindström: Not yet met - will become mentor/ally
relationships.Erik_Månsson: Professionally opposed - represents the type who dismisses her research
relationships.Viktor_Bergman: Will recognize him as validation that individuals notice what institutions ignore

physical_description: Practical academic style, carries battered laptop covered in stickers, gestures when explaining concepts, intense focus when listening
background: Grew up in rural Sweden, pursued tech career with idealism, became disillusioned watching ethics be deprioritized, now fights from academic position
skills: Network of academic and activist contacts
